title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: John Setka has been removed from the Labor Party following a long drawn out battle between the Opposition and the embattled union leader to remain a member. In June, Anthony Albanese announced his intention to have Mr Sekta expelled from the party for bringing the "party into disrepute". The Victorian CFMMEU boss filed a challenge with the courts to stop the expulsion, but the case was thrown out of court. On Wednesday, Mr Albanese announced Mr Setka had withdrawn his appeal and resigned as a member of the Victorian branch of the Labor Party. "It is a very satisfactory result in the interests of the Labor Party, and might I say, for the interest of trade union people everywhere," Mr Albanese said. Image: News Corp Australia
